business.headline: LIC refutes Washington Post report on $3.9-billion Adani investment planA Washington Post report claimed that the Finance Ministry expedited a proposal directing nearly $3.9 billion (Rs 33,000 crore) in investments from the Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) into the Adani Group. The life insurance major rejected the claims as baseless.
Writing a will? These common mistakes can land it in courtFrom Bollywood families to neighbourhood households, inheritance battles have shown that even the most watertight wills can spring leaks.

Reliance says it will comply with new US, Western sanctions on Russian oilThe oil-to-retail behemoth said that it is assessing the implications of restrictions announced by the European Union, the United Kingdom and the United States on crude oil imports from Russia and the export of refined products to Europe.

No trade deals with a gun to our head: Piyush Goyal on India-US trade talksThis special report covers Union Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal's firm message on India's approach to international trade negotiations, particularly regarding the United States. Speaking at the Berlin Global Dialogue, Mr. Goyal made it clear that India will not be rushed into agreements. He stated, 'we do not do deals in a hurry, and we do not go ahead and sign any deals with deadlines or with a gun to our head'. The minister emphasized that for India, trade deals are not merely about tariffs or market access but are long-term partnerships built on trust and mutual respect between nations. This stance comes amid ongoing trade discussions with both the US and the European Union, where India is advocating for fair and equitable agreements that benefit its businesses and economy in the long run.

Don't do deals with gun to our head: Piyush Goyal on trade talks with USIndia is exploring newer markets to reduce the impact of high tariffs and ensure fair trade terms for its exporters, said Piyush Goyal. He noted that India's approach is guided by strategy and self-interest rather than external pressure.
Sensex closes 320 points lower, Nifty below 25,800; HUL down 3%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 344.52 points to close at 84,211.88, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 96.25 points to end at 25,795.15.

Have you been investing in mutual funds the wrong way all this time?Experts say that most investors rely only on absolute returns while judging a mutual fund's performance. They focus on the number showing how much profit they've made, without understanding the factors behind those returns.

US maize import talks rattle Indian farmers as prices fall below MSPReports suggest that if the trade deal goes through and American maize starts entering Indian markets — prices could crash, and farmers may face huge losses.

Sensex tumbles 600 points: Why the stock market is falling todayThe fall came as investors engaged in profit booking following recent gains. After sustained upward movements, it is common for markets to experience short-term corrections as participants secure returns.

Gold ETFs vs physical gold: What smart investors are looking at, explains expertGold may be timeless, but the way Indians invest in it is changing fast. With rising awareness of hidden costs, gold ETFs are gaining traction as a smarter, hassle-free alternative.

How Piyush Pandey made India fall in love with adsPiyush Pandey transformed Indian advertising with heartfelt stories and local flavour. His campaigns blended wit and emotion, leaving a lasting cultural impact.

Remembering Piyush Pandey: The ad legend who made brands immortalFor over four decades, the Jaipur-born storyteller reshaped Indian advertising, turning simple commercials into cultural phenomena and making brands like Fevicol, Cadbury, and Asian Paints inseparable from the Indian consciousness.​

CA explains why saving before spending works best for financial stabilityWhile most people save whatever is left after spending, CA Meenal Goel flips the approach. Her mantra, prioritise savings before expenses, has helped her stay financially secure and stress-free.

Error in your ITR filing? Here's how to correct it with an updated returnRealised there's an error in your ITR after submission? You're not alone. Many taxpayers make small mistakes while filing, but the good news is — you can still correct them through an updated return.

Why the world's central banks are buying gold like never beforeNot just households and investors, but central banks around the globe are buying gold like it's Dhanteras every day. So why are the world's biggest buyers going for bullion? Read on to find out.
Target announces 1,800 job cuts in a decade amid falling salesAll corporate employees in the US have been asked to work from home next week as the company finalises its restructuring process.

Gold, silver prices continue to fall: Is the rally over and what should you do next?After a nine-week winning streak, gold and silver prices are finally losing steam as investors book profits amid a stronger dollar, easing global tensions, and anticipation over key US economic data.

Banks to allow up to 4 nominees per account from November 1. Here's how it helps youThe decision to allow four nominees aims to make the claim settlement process smoother, more transparent, and uniform across all banks in the country.

Satish Shah dies: Remembering the veteran actor's life on and off-screen Veteran actor Satish Shah, celebrated for his iconic comic roles, died on October 25 at 74. Over a career spanning nearly five decades, he appeared in more than 250 films and TV shows.

Sarabhai vs Sarabhai actor Satish Shah dies at 74 Popular actor Satish Shah, best known for his role in 'Sarabhai vs Sarabhai', died on October 25. The 74-year-old was suffering from kidney-related issues.

The Girlfriend trailer: Rashmika Mandanna battles love, control and pain The trailer of 'The Girlfriend' gives a gripping glimpse of Rashmika Mandanna as a woman trapped in a toxic relationship. Directed by Rahul Ravindran, the film explores emotional turmoil through a strong female lens.

Shakti Shalini: Ayushmann welcomes Aneet Padda to Maddock Horror Comedy Universe Ayushmann Khurrana welcomes Gen Z actor Aneet Padda to the Maddock Horror Comedy Universe with 'Shakti Shalini'. The upcoming film is a female-driven horror-comedy announced with 'Thamma's premiere.

Amitabh Bachchan, son Abhishek attend last rites of ad legend Piyush Pandey. Video The death of advertising pioneer Piyush Pandey has saddened the creative world, with Amitabh and Abhishek Bachchan paying respects at his Mumbai funeral. Visuals of the duo at the last rites on Saturday circulated widely.

'Grooming gang' scandal involving Pak men is bad news for UK's Starmer govtThe UK has been affected by the "grooming gangs" scandal for over 20 years, involving thousands of child sex abuse cases. Most perpetrators were of Pakistani origin, often in Labour-governed areas. Labour politicians initially suppressed the perpetrators' identity to protect votes, but were eventually forced to act due to mounting public pressure.

BJP got Rs 945 crore from pharma firms: Digvijaya Singh's claim amid Coldrif rowSenior Congress leader Digvijaya Singh claimed the BJP received Rs 945 crore in electoral bonds from pharma firms. The claim comes amid investigations into the deaths of 26 children in Madhya Pradesh linked to the contaminated Coldrif syrup.

Doctor who was raped had claimed MP pressured her to falsify medical reportsA woman doctor in Maharashtra's Satara died by suicide after accusing a police officer of repeated rape and harassment. It has now emerged that she faced pressure to falsify medical reports from police as well as an unnamed MP.

Meet the Chennai professor with 150 degrees, and the promise behind his storyProfessor VN Parthiban from Chennai has collected more than 150 degrees over 30 years, spending most of his salary on study and aiming to cross 200. It all started with a promise.

Has Trump taken a leaf out of Indian construction manual for White House project?Donald Trump might have built a real estate empire all through his life, but when it comes to constructing a ballroom at the White House, the US President is following the typical style of Indian projects. From summoning a bevy of bulldozers to starting without approval to cost escalation, it has all the hallmarks of an Indian construction project.

Live: Amit Shah warns against jungle raj, asks people to vote wiselyBihar Election News Live Updates: Bihar's political battlefield heated up as both the ruling NDA and the opposition Mahagathbandhan have gone all-out with parallel rallies across the state to woo voters. Prime Minister Narendra Modi led the charge for the BJP-led coalition, addressing back-to-back rallies in Samastipur and Begusarai. He urged voters to deliver a "record-breaking" victory to the NDA. On the opposition side, RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav, freshly declared as the Mahagathbandhan's chief ministerial face, hit the campaign trail after days of internal rift over seat-sharing and ticket distribution. Yadav addressed a string of rallies in Patna, Muzaffarpur, Samastipur, and Vaishali, signalling that the INDIA bloc was ready for a direct contest with the NDA. Follow indiatoday.in for the latest updates.

Bowl with heart, think with head: Gambhir's advice fuels Harshit's Sydney showIndia fast bowler Harshit Rana, who has been under criticism since his selection for the tour of Australia, delivered a riveting performance in the final ODI of the series against Australia.

'Killer' Commutes: Is Driving The Reason Behind Your Backache? | Health360 With Sneha MordaniThis special report features badminton star Jwala Gutta on her decision to donate surplus breast milk to a government hospital after the birth of her child. Gutta addresses the significant taboos surrounding this noble cause, stating, 'I've heard the reasons like, why should we share our milk...then are the castes matching, that is another issue, I believe'. Having donated approximately 50 litres, she advocates for greater awareness to combat misconceptions related to caste, religion, and body image that hinder life-saving donations. The programme also investigates the severe health toll of long, traffic-filled commutes on daily commuters, highlighting risks such as extreme posture problems, chronic back and knee pain, and spinal damage. Experts provide advice on correct driving posture and lifestyle changes to mitigate the damage from a sedentary lifestyle.

Stunning Alana King becomes first bowler with 7-wicket haul in Women's World CupAlana King set the record for the best figures in the history of the Women's World Cup after she took a seven-wicket haul against South Africa on Saturday at the Holkar Stadium in Indore.

India Thrash Aussies By 9 Wickets | Rohit's Ton, Kohli's 50 Fuel 2027 WC SpeculationThis special report centres on India's commanding nine-wicket ODI victory over Australia in Sydney, powered by captain Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli. The match saw Sharma score his 33rd ODI century, while Kohli silenced critics with a crucial half-century after two ducks in the series. 'Form may be temporary but class is permanent,' as our colleague Nikhil Naas noted on the broadcast, perfectly capturing Kohli's timely return to form. The discussion also delves into the futures of these two stalwarts, who have retired from T20 internationals, and what their performances mean for their potential participation in the 2027 ODI World Cup. Their emotional reaction on the field has fuelled speculation that this could be their final tour on Australian soil, marking the end of an era for Indian cricket fans down under.

Lionel Messi's Argentina friendly in Kochi postponed, await FIFA approval: MinisterThe Argentina football team and Lionel Messi's scheduled friendly match in Kerala has been postponed. The delay is due to pending FIFA approval and concerns raised by local individuals.

Ro-Ko Silence Critics! Rohit's Century, Kohli's Fifty Power India to Consolation Win in SydneyThis special report focuses on the performance of Indian cricket stalwarts Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli in the third and final ODI against Australia in Sydney. Amidst swirling debates about their future in the team ahead of the 2027 World Cup, both players delivered standout performances, with Rohit Sharma scoring an unbeaten century and Virat Kohli hitting a crucial half-century after being dismissed for two consecutive ducks earlier in the series. The reporter in the field stated, 'both have shown that you know cricket belongs to us and that is what they are doing'. Their partnership ensured a comfortable 9-wicket victory for India, although Australia clinched the series 2-1. The match also highlighted questions around Shubman Gill's new role as ODI captain and the selectors' path forward.

Aus Cricketers Molestation Shocker In Indore; Accused With Criminal History ArrestedThis special report focuses on the shocking molestation of two Australian women cricketers in Indore, Madhya Pradesh, during the ICC Women's Cricket World Cup. The Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) and Cricket Australia have both responded to the incident, which has raised serious questions about player security. BCCI Secretary Devajit Saikia stated, 'Very unfortunate incident, and this type of incident brings disrepute. The Madhya Pradesh police acted swiftly, arresting the accused, identified as Akil Khan, who was allegedly following the players on a motorcycle before inappropriately touching one of them. Khan reportedly has a prior criminal record. The BCCI has initiated an internal inquiry, while authorities investigate any potential security lapses.

Virat Kohli roars back to form with a fighting half-century against AustraliaThis special report focuses on the 3rd ODI between India and Australia in Sydney, where star batsmen Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli led India's charge. The broadcast captured the moment Kohli, after a period of poor form, reached his half-century, silencing critics. The anchor noted, 'Kohli has scored half a century against Australia while there was talk of why Kohli was not at his best, but clearly those mouths stand sharp today as Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma have come back and how'. The report highlights the formidable 'RoKo' partnership, with Sharma standing unbeaten at 85 and Kohli scoring a comeback 50, driving India to a strong position. Fans at the SCG celebrated as the duo dominated the Australian bowling attack.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
